title: Welcome to the Hundred Heroines Advent Calendar for 2025!
synopsis: What do Cecilia Glaisher (1828 - 1892) and our very own Rita Long have in common? Snowflakes! Rita's beautiful cyanotype snowflake prints are available as christmas cards from the Hundred Heroines Museum shop now. All proceeds go towards supporting the museum and our Youth Programme

title: Giving Tuesday
synopsis: Yin leads our Giving Tuesday campaign
caption: Image © Rita Long

title: Born #OTD 1869 - Anne Brigman
synopsis: Anne Brigman (1869-1950) was an American photographer, artist and feminist icon. She freed herself and the women she photographed from corsets and clichés, revolutionising female nude photography.
caption: 'The Storm Tree' by Anne Brigman, 1911

title: The Joyful Women's Collective
synopsis: The Joyful Women Collective meets tonight at 6.30pm, where joyful creativity helps support our youth programme

title: Come visit! Hinda Schuman exhibition: Done Doing Time
synopsis: 'Done Doing Time', our challenging new exhibition displays the work of Hinda Schuman in her 2023 exploration of two women from one of the most vulnerable, most isolated demographics in America: women released from prison.

title: Merch! Merch! Merch!
synopsis: Looking for a gift for the feminists in your life? Come and check out our Hinda Schuman exhibition and maybe buy a tea towel to support us! We're open from 11am - 4pm, Thursdays, Friday and Saturdays

title: Congratulations Lisl!
synopsis:
Congratulations to Lisl Ponger (one of our Heroines) on the publication of her new book:
Semiotische Geister / Semiotic Ghosts, published by the Austrian Film Institute.

Find out more about Lisl's work, including a recent workshop with our Youth Project.
caption: Lisl Ponger - Semiotische Geister / Semiotic Ghosts - cover image,<br class="wide" /> photo credit: Austrian Film Museum

title: Died #OTD 1954 - Claude Cahun
synopsis: Although artists have long been tackling gender norms and at the forefront of the LGBTQ+ rights movement, history has not always been kind to them. Why not (re)discover the work of gender nonconforming artist Claude Cahun today?
caption:
Self portrait (in robe with masks attached), 1928 © Claude Cahun.
Courtesy of the Jersey Heritage Collections

title: Born #OTD 1913 - Homai Vyarawalla
synopsis: Homai Vyarawalla (1913-2012) was a pioneer in more than one sense of the word. Not only was she India's first female photojournalist but her career documented the overthrow of British colonial rule. Check out Monika Baker's film: Dalda 13.
caption:
Image credit: The Bombay Zoo, Late 1930s, Homai Vyarawalla.
Courtesy HV Archive/Alkazi Collection of Photography.

title: Human Rights Day
synopsis: Our anti-violence logo designed by Donna Ferrato.

title: Lisl Ponger's film recommendations
synopsis: Looking for something different to watch over the festivities? Dive into our Film Festival Archive, created by Lisl Ponger during lockdown in 2020, including a different programme every week for a year.
